00001 /***************************************************************************/
00033 #include <stdint.h>
00034 #include "em_device.h"
00035 
00036 /*******************************************************************************
00037  ******************************   DEFINES   ************************************
00038  ******************************************************************************/
00039 
00041 #define EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ  (32768UL)
00042 #define EFM32_ULFRCO_FREQ (1000UL)
00043 
00044 /*******************************************************************************
00045  **************************   LOCAL VARIABLES   ********************************
00046  ******************************************************************************/
00047 
00048 /* System oscillator frequencies. These frequencies are normally constant */
00049 /* for a target, but they are made configurable in order to allow run-time */
00050 /* handling of different boards. The crystal oscillator clocks can be set */
00051 /* compile time to a non-default value by defining respective EFM_nFXO_FREQ */
00052 /* values according to board design. By defining the EFM_nFXO_FREQ to 0, */
00053 /* one indicates that the oscillator is not present, in order to save some */
00054 /* SW footprint. */
00055 
00056 #ifndef EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ
00057 #define EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ            (38000000UL)
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #ifndef EFM32_HFXO_FREQ
00061 #define EFM32_HFXO_FREQ                 (38400000UL)
00062 #endif
00063 
00064 #ifndef EFM32_HFRCO_STARTUP_FREQ
00065 #define EFM32_HFRCO_STARTUP_FREQ        (19000000UL)
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 
00069 /* Do not define variable if HF crystal oscillator not present */
00070 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0UL)
00071 
00073 static uint32_t SystemHFXOClock = EFM32_HFXO_FREQ;
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 #ifndef EFM32_LFXO_FREQ
00078 #define EFM32_LFXO_FREQ (EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ)
00079 #endif
00080 /* Do not define variable if LF crystal oscillator not present */
00081 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0UL)
00082 
00084 static uint32_t SystemLFXOClock = 32768UL;
00086 #endif
00087 
00088 
00089 /*******************************************************************************
00090  **************************   GLOBAL VARIABLES   *******************************
00091  ******************************************************************************/
00092 
00100 uint32_t SystemCoreClock;
00101 
00102 
00113 uint32_t SystemHfrcoFreq = EFM32_HFRCO_STARTUP_FREQ;
00114 
00115 
00116 /*******************************************************************************
00117  **************************   GLOBAL FUNCTIONS   *******************************
00118  ******************************************************************************/
00119 
00120 /***************************************************************************/
00137 uint32_t SystemCoreClockGet(void)
00138 {
00139   uint32_t ret;
00140   uint32_t presc;
00141 
00142   ret   = SystemHFClockGet();
00143   presc = (CMU->HFCOREPRESC & _CMU_HFCOREPRESC_PRESC_MASK) >>
00144           _CMU_HFCOREPRESC_PRESC_SHIFT;
00145   ret  /= (presc + 1);
00146 
00147   /* Keep CMSIS system clock variable up-to-date */
00148   SystemCoreClock = ret;
00149 
00150   return ret;
00151 }
00152 
00153 
00154 /***************************************************************************/
00164 uint32_t SystemMaxCoreClockGet(void)
00165 {
00166   return (EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ > EFM32_HFXO_FREQ ? \
00167           EFM32_HFRCO_MAX_FREQ : EFM32_HFXO_FREQ);
00168 }
00169 
00170 
00171 /***************************************************************************/
00181 uint32_t SystemHFClockGet(void)
00182 {
00183   uint32_t ret;
00184 
00185   switch (CMU->HFCLKSTATUS & _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_MASK)
00186   {
00187     case CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_LFXO:
00188 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00189       ret = SystemLFXOClock;
00190 #else
00191       /* We should not get here, since core should not be clocked. May */
00192       /* be caused by a misconfiguration though. */
00193       ret = 0;
00194 #endif
00195       break;
00196 
00197     case CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_LFRCO:
00198       ret = EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ;
00199       break;
00200 
00201     case CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFXO:
00202 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00203       ret = SystemHFXOClock;
00204 #else
00205       /* We should not get here, since core should not be clocked. May */
00206       /* be caused by a misconfiguration though. */
00207       ret = 0;
00208 #endif
00209       break;
00210 
00211     default: /* CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFRCO */
00212       ret = SystemHfrcoFreq;
00213       break;
00214   }
00215 
00216   return ret;
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 /**************************************************************************/
00230 uint32_t SystemHFXOClockGet(void)
00231 {
00232   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00233 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00234   return SystemHFXOClock;
00235 #else
00236   return 0;
00237 #endif
00238 }
00239 
00240 
00241 /**************************************************************************/
00256 void SystemHFXOClockSet(uint32_t freq)
00257 {
00258   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00259 #if (EFM32_HFXO_FREQ > 0)
00260   SystemHFXOClock = freq;
00261 
00262   /* Update core clock frequency if HFXO is used to clock core */
00263   if ((CMU->HFCLKSTATUS & _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_MASK) == CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_HFXO)
00264   {
00265     /* The function will update the global variable */
00266     SystemCoreClockGet();
00267   }
00268 #else
00269   (void)freq; /* Unused parameter */
00270 #endif
00271 }
00272 
00273 
00274 /**************************************************************************/
00286 void SystemInit(void)
00287 {
00288 #if (__FPU_PRESENT == 1)
00289   /* Set floating point coprosessor access mode. */
00290   SCB->CPACR |= ((3UL << 10 * 2) |      /* set CP10 Full Access */
00291                  (3UL << 11 * 2));      /* set CP11 Full Access */
00292 #endif
00293 }
00294 
00295 
00296 /**************************************************************************/
00306 uint32_t SystemLFRCOClockGet(void)
00307 {
00308   /* Currently we assume that this frequency is properly tuned during */
00309   /* manufacturing and is not changed after reset. If future requirements */
00310   /* for re-tuning by user, we can add support for that. */
00311   return EFM32_LFRCO_FREQ;
00312 }
00313 
00314 
00315 /**************************************************************************/
00325 uint32_t SystemULFRCOClockGet(void)
00326 {
00327   /* The ULFRCO frequency is not tuned, and can be very inaccurate */
00328   return EFM32_ULFRCO_FREQ;
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 /**************************************************************************/
00342 uint32_t SystemLFXOClockGet(void)
00343 {
00344   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00345 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00346   return SystemLFXOClock;
00347 #else
00348   return 0;
00349 #endif
00350 }
00351 
00352 
00353 /**************************************************************************/
00368 void SystemLFXOClockSet(uint32_t freq)
00369 {
00370   /* External crystal oscillator present? */
00371 #if (EFM32_LFXO_FREQ > 0)
00372   SystemLFXOClock = freq;
00373 
00374   /* Update core clock frequency if LFXO is used to clock core */
00375   if ((CMU->HFCLKSTATUS & _CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_MASK) == CMU_HFCLKSTATUS_SELECTED_LFXO)
00376   {
00377     /* The function will update the global variable */
00378     SystemCoreClockGet();
00379   }
00380 #else
00381   (void)freq; /* Unused parameter */
00382 #endif
00383 }
